id: The Wall Street JournalOpinionMilitary Spouses Also Serve
paragraph:
November 17, 2018 Mike Quinn served in the U.S. Army for 24 years, rising to the rank of sergeant major. He deployed to Iraq, Afghanistan, Bosnia, the Philippines and Korea. Between deployments, he met the woman he married. They moved seven times in the next nine years, once to Japan. Each time, his wife had to seek new employment. He eventually retired due to the toll on his family.  Don Evans is a lieutenant colonel in the Army. He’s been married for 19 years and his family has moved seven times. His wife, a nurse practitioner, had to get...
